abstract: The Upshot; housing market nationwide seems to have normalized after years of fluctuating between being too hot or too cold; housing prices seem to be rising at similar low, single-digit rates as incomes, rent prices and other fundamentals; conditions seem to suggest growth in the market that will be sustainable.
lead_paragraph: The housing market in much of the nation seems to be in a Goldilocks moment, neither too hot nor too cold, with low mortgage rates an added bonus.

headline.main: After an Era of Ups and Downs, Home Prices Return to Sanity
headline.print_headline: Housing Prices Find a Balance After Volatility

snippet: The housing market in much of the nation seems to be in a Goldilocks moment, neither too hot nor too cold, with low mortgage rates an added bonus.

keywords.value: Standard & Poor's Case-Shiller Home Price Index
